nodes.documentation:
ICOToken for the timelessluxurygroup.com by Horizon-Globex.com of Switzerland.

 * An ERC20 standard

 * Author: Horizon Globex GmbH Development Team

 * Dev Notes
  NOTE: There is no fallback function as this contract will never contain Ether, only the ICO tokens.
  NOTE: There is no approveAndCall/receiveApproval or ERC223 functionality.
  NOTE: Coins will never be minted beyond those at contract creation.
  NOTE: Zero transfers are allowed - we don't want to break a valid transaction chain.
  NOTE: There is no selfDestruct, changeOwner or migration path - this is the only contract.
nodes.name: ICOToken

nodes.documentation:
Get the current allowanceCollection that the approver has allowed 'spender' to spend on their behalf.

     * See also: approve() and transferFrom().

     * @param _approver  The account that owns the tokens.
@param _spender   The account that can spend the approver's tokens.
nodes.name: allowance

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot add new referrals after ICO is complete."

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot add new referrals after ICO is complete."

nodes.documentation:
Add the link between the referrer and who they referred.

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform offers functionality for referrers to sign-up
to refer Contributors. Upon such referred Contributions, Company shall automatically
award 1% of our "owner" ICO tokens to the referrer as coded by this Smart Contract.

     * All referrers must successfully complete our ICO KYC review prior to being allowed on-board.
-- End ICO-Platform Note --

     * @param referrer  The person doing the referring.
@param referee   The person that was referred.
nodes.name: refer
transfer

nodes.documentation:
Allow another address to spend tokens on your behalf.

     * transferFrom can be called multiple times until the approved balance goes to zero.
Subsequent calls to this function overwrite the previous balance.
To change from a non-zero value to another non-zero value you must first set the
allowance to zero - it is best to use safeApprove when doing this as you will
manually have to check for transfers to ensure none happened before the zero allowance
was set.

     * @param _spender   The address authorized to spend your tokens.
@param _value     The maximum amount of tokens they can spend.
nodes.name: approve

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The expected old value did not match current allowance."

arguments.value: The expected old value did not match current allowance.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The expected old value did not match current allowance."

nodes.name: safeApprove

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The ICO phase has ended, you can no longer set KYC hashes."

arguments.value: The ICO phase has ended, you can no longer set KYC hashes.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The ICO phase has ended, you can no longer set KYC hashes."

nodes.documentation:
The hash for all Know Your Customer information is calculated outside but stored here.
This storage will be cleared once the ICO completes, see closeIco().

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's KYC app will register a hash of the Contributors
KYC submission on the blockchain. Our Swiss financial-intermediary KYC provider will be 
notified of the submission and retrieve the Contributor data for formal review.

     * All Contributors must successfully complete our ICO KYC review prior to being allowed on-board.
-- End ICO-Platform Note --

     * @param sha   The hash of the customer data.
nodes.name: setKycHash

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The ICO phase has ended, you can no longer approve."

arguments.value: The ICO phase has ended, you can no longer approve.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The ICO phase has ended, you can no longer approve."

nodes.documentation:
A user has passed KYC verification, store them on the blockchain in the order it happened.
This will be cleared once the ICO completes, see closeIco().

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's registered KYC provider submits their approval
for this Contributor to particpate using the ICO-Platform portal. 

     * Each Contributor will then be sent the Ethereum, Bitcoin and IBAN account numbers to
deposit their Approved Contribution in exchange for ICO Tokens.
-- End ICO-Platform Note --

     * @param who   The user's address.
nodes.name: kycApproved

nodes.documentation:
Set the address that has the authority to approve users by KYC.

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform shall register a fully licensed Swiss KYC
provider to assess each potential Contributor for KYC and AML under Swiss law. 

     * -- End ICO-Platform Note --

     * @param who   The address of the KYC provider.
nodes.name: setKycProvider

nodes.documentation:
Set the issuer address

     * @param who   The address of the issuer.
nodes.name: setIssuer

nodes.documentation:
Retrieve the KYC hash from the specified index.

     * @param   index   The index into the array.
nodes.name: getKycHash

nodes.documentation:
Retrieve the validated KYC address from the specified index.

     * @param   index   The index into the array.
nodes.name: getKycApproved

nodes.documentation:
When someone referred (the referee) purchases tokens the referrer gets a 1% bonus from the central pool.

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's portal shall award referrers as part of the ICO
ICO Token issuance procedure as overseen by the Swiss KYC provider. 

     * -- End ICO-Platform Note --

     * @param referee   The referred account who just purchased some tokens.
@param referrer  The account that referred the one purchasing tokens.
@param value     The number of tokens purchased by the referee.
nodes.name: awardReferralBonus

nodes.documentation:
During the ICO phase the owner will allocate tokens once KYC completes and funds are deposited.

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's portal shall issue ICO Token to Contributors on receipt of 
the Approved Contribution funds at the KYC providers Escrow account/wallets.
Only after ICO Tokens are issued to the Contributor can the Swiss KYC provider allow the transfer
of funds from their Escrow to Company.

     * -- End ICO-Platform Note --

     * @param to       The recipient of the tokens.
@param value    The number of tokens to send.
nodes.name: icoTransfer

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The ICO phase has already ended, you cannot close it again."

arguments.value: The ICO phase has already ended, you cannot close it again.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The ICO phase has already ended, you cannot close it again."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot close ICO when a balance remains in the owner account."

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot close ICO when a balance remains in the owner account."

nodes.documentation:
End the ICO phase in accordance with KYC procedures and clean up.

     * ---- ICO-Platform Note ----
The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's portal shall halt the ICO at the end of the 
Contribution Period, as defined in the ICO Terms and Conditions at timelessluxurygroup.com.

     * -- End ICO-Platform Note --
nodes.name: closeIco

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot send tokens from null address"

arguments.value: Cannot send tokens from null address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot send tokens from null address"

nodes.documentation:
Permanently mint tokens to increase the totalSupply_.

     * @param value            The number of tokens to mint.
nodes.name: mint

nodes.documentation:
Permanently destroy tokens from totalSupply_.

     * @param value            The number of tokens to burn.
nodes.name: burn

devdoc.details: Math operations with safety checks that throw on error  * Source: https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/zeppelin-solidity/blob/master/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol
devdoc.title: SafeMath

allowance(address,address).notice: Get the current allowanceCollection that the approver has allowed 'spender' to spend on their behalf.      * See also: approve() and transferFrom().

approve(address,uint256).notice: Allow another address to spend tokens on your behalf.      * transferFrom can be called multiple times until the approved balance goes to zero. Subsequent calls to this function overwrite the previous balance. To change from a non-zero value to another non-zero value you must first set the allowance to zero - it is best to use safeApprove when doing this as you will manually have to check for transfers to ensure none happened before the zero allowance was set.

balanceOf(address).notice: Get the number of tokens for a specific account.

closeIco().notice: End the ICO phase in accordance with KYC procedures and clean up.      * ---- ICO-Platform Note ---- The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's portal shall halt the ICO at the end of the  Contribution Period, as defined in the ICO Terms and Conditions at timelessluxurygroup.com.      * -- End ICO-Platform Note --

constructor.notice: Initialise contract with the 50 million initial supply tokens, allocated to the creator of the contract (the owner).

getKycApproved(uint256).notice: Retrieve the validated KYC address from the specified index.

getKycHash(uint256).notice: Retrieve the KYC hash from the specified index.

icoTransfer(address,uint256).notice: During the ICO phase the owner will allocate tokens once KYC completes and funds are deposited.      * ---- ICO-Platform Note ---- The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's portal shall issue ICO Token to Contributors on receipt of  the Approved Contribution funds at the KYC providers Escrow account/wallets. Only after ICO Tokens are issued to the Contributor can the Swiss KYC provider allow the transfer of funds from their Escrow to Company.      * -- End ICO-Platform Note --

kycApproved(address).notice: A user has passed KYC verification, store them on the blockchain in the order it happened. This will be cleared once the ICO completes, see closeIco().      * ---- ICO-Platform Note ---- The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's registered KYC provider submits their approval for this Contributor to particpate using the ICO-Platform portal.       * Each Contributor will then be sent the Ethereum, Bitcoin and IBAN account numbers to deposit their Approved Contribution in exchange for ICO Tokens. -- End ICO-Platform Note --

mint(uint256).notice: Permanently mint tokens to increase the totalSupply_.

refer(address,address).notice: Add the link between the referrer and who they referred.      * ---- ICO-Platform Note ---- The horizon-globex.com ICO platform offers functionality for referrers to sign-up to refer Contributors. Upon such referred Contributions, Company shall automatically award 1% of our "owner" ICO tokens to the referrer as coded by this Smart Contract.      * All referrers must successfully complete our ICO KYC review prior to being allowed on-board. -- End ICO-Platform Note --

rewardPool().notice: The total number of reward pool tokens that remains.

safeApprove(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Allow another address to spend tokens on your behalf while mitigating a double spend.      * Subsequent calls to this function overwrite the previous balance. The old value must match the current allowance otherwise this call reverts.

setKycHash(bytes32).notice: The hash for all Know Your Customer information is calculated outside but stored here. This storage will be cleared once the ICO completes, see closeIco().      * ---- ICO-Platform Note ---- The horizon-globex.com ICO platform's KYC app will register a hash of the Contributors KYC submission on the blockchain. Our Swiss financial-intermediary KYC provider will be  notified of the submission and retrieve the Contributor data for formal review.      * All Contributors must successfully complete our ICO KYC review prior to being allowed on-board. -- End ICO-Platform Note --

setKycProvider(address).notice: Set the address that has the authority to approve users by KYC.      * ---- ICO-Platform Note ---- The horizon-globex.com ICO platform shall register a fully licensed Swiss KYC provider to assess each potential Contributor for KYC and AML under Swiss law.       * -- End ICO-Platform Note --

totalSupply().notice: The total number of tokens that exist.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfer tokens from the caller's account to the recipient.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfer pre-approved tokens on behalf of an account.      * See also: approve() and allowance().

userdoc.notice: ICOToken for the timelessluxurygroup.com by Horizon-Globex.com of Switzerland.  * An ERC20 standard  * Author: Horizon Globex GmbH Development Team  * Dev Notes  NOTE: There is no fallback function as this contract will never contain Ether, only the ICO tokens.  NOTE: There is no approveAndCall/receiveApproval or ERC223 functionality.  NOTE: Coins will never be minted beyond those at contract creation.  NOTE: Zero transfers are allowed - we don't want to break a valid transaction chain.  NOTE: There is no selfDestruct, changeOwner or migration path - this is the only contract.
